annotation.TEXT: And don't be afraid to switch sides if you need to. Hopefully, you can get her to stop moving while she's lined up perfectly to get clobbered.
Also, I cannot consider this a perfect run if I don't get the book, so I'm going to do that too. Fortunately, it's far easier than dealing with the rapid-fire fairies, although a bit time-consuming.

So, chase after her and stomp her three times to win. It's not that difficult, and you have plenty of time to catch up to her thrice before you reach the end of the area, so don't worry too much about your speed.
Up next are a bunch of hidden blocks. Reveal them quickly so that you don't get trapped in the red-spiky dead end.
Okay, back to boss battles now. Next up is Yoshika here in 4-4.
You don't want to be near her when she's surrounded with bullets, but after the bullets clear out, you'll have a few seconds to get in some hits before she warps again.
The lightning follows a fixed pattern during phase 3, so you can easily dodge it again. Watch out for the fairies shooting aimed bullets at you, as well as Nue's occasional claw swipe.
Okay, now for the battle against all three fairies in 2-8.
You can jump on her, and you can also hit her with your special attacks too. Also, it would be a good idea to take out the other fairies in the arena.
When the fight starts, she'll move towards you a bit, then leap into the air, and fire six sets of aimed spreads. You can score some hits as she ascends, but don't get greedy.
And I'm done just like that! Getting in those rapid hits while she was under the block up there really helped. Anyway, I had a total of 7 failures before this successful flawless victory.
This one's easy, and you can destroy the crystals pretty fast if you position yourself correctly.
Now, when she crashes down this time, beware, as she'll leap up again and fire an aimed big bullet as she does so. After she lands again, then you can get in lots of hits.
Watch out for fast-moving chocolate FOEs here. Try to activate the switch with the right timing to dump them onto the lower level.
I had 4 failed attempts before I pulled off this flawless victory.
Now, the greatest threat during phase 2 is definitely the lightning, as it seems to strike completely randomly, and there's barely any time to react to the warning lines.
YES!!! Phase 2 is done! That was the hardest part, mainly due to the lightning. Okay, for the final phase, target the head again.
Yes, very good. Now, I don't need it, but I kinda want the 1-up from this block. Nitori's weak double jump makes this really tricky to hit, but it still can be done.
Definitely be careful of the FOEs she drops during the third phase, but again, they can help you locate her.
Star likes to make herself invisible, but you can still see her occasionally, and you can always attack her, whether she's visible or not.
Done. Another first-try victory.
For the second phase, she mostly fires horizontal bullets, so get in some rapid stomps and try to end that phase quickly too.
The third yellow tile here contains a very weak spring, so you should instead normal jump over the red spikes on the floor there.
Next, I'm going to slowly stream the shots coming from below here.

Things can get hectic in the final phase, but if you focus on the true Reisen (who doesn't have a cursor on her), you may be able to end this quickly. I think she does eventually use aimed shots if you're not this fast, though.
If you want, you can try to get up here after the bunnies clear out for two 1-ups.
And there's yet another first-try victory for me.
Whoa, that was lucky! Now, for the rest of the level, I'm going to use the "hope and pray" method!

So, yeah... About that lightning... It's not a major threat in phases 1 or 3, because it always strikes the same places in those phases, so you can easily dodge it. However, phase 2's lightning is a different story.
Done. I succeeded on my first try there.
Anyway, fall through a fake floor over here in order to drop down where Tewi is and stomp her, which finishes the level. Also, you can grab that aforementioned 1-up from this side safely.
Next we have Sunny Milk in 2-4, which is another chase.
But if you do hit it, just be aware that they will eventually come back down.
Phase 2 works similarly, just with slightly more bullets.

Gotta chase her vertically instead of horizontally. It's still not too difficult, although I think you don't have as much leeway before reaching the end of the area as you do with Luna, so don't dawdle.
Gotcha! And there's another first-try perfect for me! The bosses WILL get harder eventually.
Okay, I got lucky with the lightning again...
And that's it for this "boss battle". Another first-try perfect for me.
These yellow blocks contain springs. Also, there's a 1-up on the lower route here, but it's a bit risky to go for, especially with the hidden blocks present.

You have to attack the snake tail during this phase. If you're lucky, you can bounce off of a fairy to help you up there. But otherwise, wait for the highest clouds to appear, and pray that you don't get struck by lightning.
Alright, time for phase 3. First, Nue will repel you to the edge of the arena (or try to, anyway). Then, it's a matter of carefully working your way through the bullets back to Nue and stomping her.
If you aim a special at the transformed Nue's face with the right timing just as she fades in, you might be able to get in some free hits. I think Nitori's Extending Arm is most effective for this.
Star and Luna are down, now I just gotta find Sunny.

Alice is particularly effective for blocking the shots from the final crystal, but I decided I wanted to do this with Nitori for every single boss. And really, if you're not careless, this is easy even without Alice.
Up next, Seiga and Yoshika together in 4-8. Seiga's the primary target, of course, but there is a point where you must attack Yoshika.
I'll find her eventually.
Next up is Luna Child in 2-2. It's more of a chase than a proper boss battle, but I'm going to count these chases as bosses anyway.
Now, right away, go straight for the kill on this fairy immediately! Do not hesitate!
BTW, you may want to kick one of the green duders that are on the floor at some point, so that it can clean up the floor of any other grounded mooks throughout the battle.
I'll just wait for this fairy to come over here, kill her, then dodge in between the leftover bullets.
D'oh, I missed.
Well, I made it to her right side anyway. Now I've just gotta carefully land a few more stomps.
BTW, you can reach these two 1-ups by bouncing off of this electric FOE, which I don't think we did during our regular playthrough.
Be careful of the stationary bullets that Star leaves behind during the second phase, but you can use those to help track her position.
Done. I also succeeded at this one on my first try.
Warning: There's a hidden wall in front of that 1-up, and the floor right next to it is fake, so if you try to go straight for that 1-up from the left, you'll fall to your death.
Yes! I beat her fast enough that I didn't even have to dodge that kunai barrage! I did have 2 failures before pulling off that flawless victory, BTW.
Huzzah! I had 11 failures before pulling off that flawless victory.
So, yeah. Shortly after phase 3 starts, Seiga disappears, and won't reappear until you hit Yoshika with a couple of green duders.
Up next is Reisen in 3-9, and at this point, the game's done fooling around. This is the first time I failed to get a flawless victory on my first try.
Make sure you're aware of all the tricks that are played in this area, such as hidden and fake walls/blocks, and things like that.
Yeah, unfortunately, you can't trigger the switch remotely with a special move.
Now, shortly before Seiga warps, black circles will appear. I believe those are her possible warping destinations. Then, shortly after she warps, she starts surrounding herself with bullets.
To win, kick green duders at her a total of 6 times. The phase changes with the first and third hits.

Marisa is fast enough to hit the switch and escape, and I suppose anyone can escape with an air dash speed boost, but I wasn't aware of that yet when I recorded this, so I'm not getting those point items down below here.
Hitting this ♣-switch will make this platform try to ♣-sandwich you into the spikes above.
Next, she'll surround herself with lots of bullets and then launch them in random directions. Keep your distance, obviously.
Unfortunately, you can't hit Nue with special moves, which would've been nice during this part. But, Alice is great at blocking these bullets with her doll barrier.
...All while running and screaming! AAAAAAAAHHHH!!!
Next on the agenda is Tewi in world 3-5. This is mainly just a standard autoscroller, but it does play the mid-boss music.
That appears to be all of them. Of course, you don't need to reveal them all. Okay, next up, Tewi will blow a whistle and enemies will come at you. Pay attention for this.
Hitting this ♠-switch makes those FOEs jump into the air. If you avoid it, you don't have to deal with that.
After that, she'll leap high into the air and try to crash down on top of you. This is easily sidestepped, and then you can get in more hits and probably finish phase 1.

Alright, Seiga's back. Fortunately, Seiga herself won't deal collision damage to you. But, watch out for her bullets, of course. Also, I think that Seiga will no longer teleport anymore at this point.
Hmm... She seems to be unusually good at hiding this time.
Her pattern during phase 2 is similar to phase 1, except her bullets are more dense and she fires some aimed shots at you as well. BTW, don't carelessly crash into Yoshika during all this, of course.
I should've made sure I was on Nue's right side instead. It's easier to approach her from the right, because there's more room to stand next to her there, and Nue CAN deal collision damage to you.
Warning: The floor under these two spirits isn't real. Still, stomping the spirits could be a good idea so that there'll be no more random shots flying about, but it is risky.

FINISH!!! I had a total of 17 failures there, including 12 to the phase 2 lightning. Okay, now that I've gotten a flawless victory on every boss, what's next? Find out next time! To be continued... Ze!
Hello, and welcome to a special bonus episode of Amapani! In this episode, I'm going to flawlessly defeat every boss in the game. First up, Nazrin in world 1-7.
Book get! Now for the nasty second half, where most of my failures in perfecting this level occurred.
DOUBLE KILL!
Just note that hits won't actually register until after the conversation is completely done, but it sounded like my Extending Arm scored 4 hits the instant the fight really started there.
Now for Star Sapphire in 2-6. This one's actually more like a proper battle.
So, you have to attack Seiga with stomps, special moves, and/or the green duders. Yep, you can hit her with those as well, even though they're likely just meant for Yoshika.

The claw swipe is dodgeable up here, and... I think I've got this won. For some reason, I can't do my downward air dash to speed up my stomps here, but unless another fairy with aimed shots appears, nothing can stop me now.
Oh, this is perfect. I just hope the last green duder I need spawns in time...
If you stand on the right edge of this step, you can stomp all of the bunnies here safely. Now be careful, as the yellow tiles have springs, and there are red spikes above.
Whoa, what a lucky break for me there! With Seiga positioned under that block, I'm able to get in hits at a really rapid rate, including several hits before she vanishes at the start of phase 3!
Yikes! That was close! Also, while attacking the snake tail, try not to stand directly beneath it, as it periodically spits out fire in a downwards cone, and you don't want to get suddenly burned.
Okay, that's the end of the first phase.
Up next, Nue in 5-5.
Made it! Oy, I had a total of 12 failed attempts before I pulled off that perfect clear!
Now, up next isn't actually a boss, but something I wanted to perfect anyway. Remember world 4-3, with its vicious rapidly-firing fairies? Let's see if I can clear this level without getting hit!
There's another rapid-fire fairy coming up here. I'll want to deal with it in a similar manner.
Okay, that was an interesting way to score a hit.
Hitting this ♠-switch will make those fairies move. It's a little easier if I don't hit the switch.
And, last, but not least, the final boss battle against Nue's transformation in 5-9.
She starts off with some aimed shots. Dodge those, then try to stomp her a bunch. If you're fast, you can end the phase before she gets off another attack.
Aha! Found you!
Try to get her into a position where you can easily hit her with a green guy. Dropping down to the lower level for a moment can help.
Stomp them and/or use special attacks on them, as usual. They do like to conceal themselves, so stay alert.
Whoa, careful.
Nothing is really a major threat during phase 1, and that phase can be completed fairly quickly. Now for phase 2...
